highlights: Premium Quality Materials- This product is made of 100% natural sisal hemp.The base and top is a weighted MDF covering the carpet.Nature High Quality Sisal Safe Plush Long Lasting Usage Stable basement, never tip over easily.
Protect your furniture: - Grab sticks and plush toys combine to attract cats to play and grab, natural sisal is suitable for cats to grab, effectively preventing cats from grabbing furniture .
Designed for indoor use- Neutral colors work well with existing decor in your home.ideal for any living room, bedroom, or home office.
34"Tall Cat Scratching Post-16 x 16 x 34 Inches,design for all size cats from kitten and adult cats .Other models are 22 " is specially designed for kitties or smaller cats.
Easy Assemble:- Just screw all parts together,Assemble needed, all tools and instructions included.Please contact us if you have any further questions.

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFC42RLJTNY3H63RORBUNJPL2TKA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 20 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  My cat absolutely loves this scratching post! He\'s very picky about them, so I was very happy about that. It was very easy to assemble and seems to be high quality. This is very sturdy, too; my cat a large cat, so often knocks posts over because he\'s so heavy, but this one stays up. If you\'re looking for a scratching post for a large cat, definitely choose this one!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGJAR3XLELBPH6CZMCNXXCILBQUQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 16 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: They are attractive, last for a long while & the tall length is a big plus
reviews.review: \n  My Feral Cat loves the tall scratch posts & works out on them several times a day= the sisal gets fuzzed out & still works. So much better than the cardboard scratchers-which my cat literally scratched up in a week & then I spent countless hours picking up & vacuuming up cardboard pieces. I have one scratch post in each room & over the last 5yrs. haven\'t had a problem with the sofa, rugs or wood furniture being scratched on.  Before the scratch posts came in tall sizes I was buying 3 or 4 & extending them.  I am happy with these & will continue to purchase them.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFPEU7M7FMXSW4EV622MJTEQPBFQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 11 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n   Have had this for a few weeks, and my cats still scratch on it. They destroyed a wicker hamper, so I put this in the spot where the hamper used to be. It’s so much better. The wicker scraps were everywhere. This does not shed like that. Very sturdy. I would recommend it. The video clip shows that my cat likes it, but prefers his brother’s head.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHQWXSBC73LYINZHRHS2UYMMQVCA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 7 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Fun sisal scratching post for kitties that love the scratch
reviews.review: \n  If you buy the 34" post, you\'ll need to refer back to the photo on Amazon because the directions that come with the easy-assembly post don\'t show the middle fabric and ball piece. This post is rather tall, so cats will not be climbing it. If they try, they might topple the post. Our more curious cat was eager to sniff out this new post as soon as it was put in place (replacing one that the two cats have managed to shred). Sisal is a much better choice than corrugated cardboard, which can send tiny airborne particles into the noses of our feline friends. Yes, the sisal slowly shreds and sheds, but it\'s easy to remove from the base with a simple brushing. I do wish that these manufacturers would use carpet fabric instead of the white, fake-fur material, which very quickly becomes dirty. Our previous post had a base of a mottled brown carpet fabric that never looked dirty (even though it probably was).\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFNHPTPUZPRL57YC4IL5BHAOO5QA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 10 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n I had previously purchased a 6’ cat condo for the new kitten but she wasn’t too interested. Then I purchased this and she hasn’t stopped playing with it yet!

Super easy to put together also. It took me about 10 minutes and it took that long because she wanted to play with it. Best money spent!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEYYJ2YP4JVQ4GMTL7XESEMIDTUA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 5 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Cats Love to Climb, Especially Kittens
reviews.review: \n  Bought this for our two very active kittens and they LOVE climbing it! I recommend the scratching post for older kitties, not the one for babies, because the babies grow up in no time, and bigger kitties  won\'t outgrow the larger post. They scramble over it constantly, and love playing with the hanging fur pouf balls that are attached.  The base is very sturdy and it is, overall) well-made.  Very easy to assemble.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGDDKF3PMJFD5DRZPOH2QG2N5NEA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 6 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I foster kittens for an animal rescue in my town, so I have several scratching posts at home.  I have three fosters right now, and they all would ignore the scratching posts in favor or my upholstered furniture.  As a last ditch effort, I ordered this scratching post.  It was an instant success.  They love the new post, and, oddly enough, have even started using the other posts as well.  They love this one the best, though.  Thank you.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEDXPN4TSMS7SITZQKR5SUYFB4WA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 7 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n We really needed something to take her off the sofas and this really did the trick. It was the easiest thing to put together and she enjoys it quite a bit; she almost tackled it, haha. Anyway, wonderful buy. Would 10/10 recommend.

Update: The other two boys took to it as well! Happy it wasn’t a waste. Will add pictures of them, too.

Update of the Update: the little ball on the string came loose. Not as durable as previously thought, so a star will be removed. Aside from that, it’s still pretty good.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHAC47I36FDJMI3XDRHCAORGDWKA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 6 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: The bottom screw is not recessed & will cause damage
reviews.review: \n  With 4 cats we have purchased a number of scratching posts; they have always had a recessed spot for the screw so as to not damage the floors. This scratching post does not have a recessed spot and thus is only going to cause damage to my hardwood floors. Perhaps it would be ok on carpet, but even then it may destroy the carpet over time as the screw protrudes a significant amount.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEWCEDBST6EVZTHLSMGCI4BF7QNQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I admit I can be cheap. But this baby was definitely worth every penny! Our 3 little claw babies have been tearing into this post everyday and it hasn\'t even fallen over once. The base is a good size to prevent it from toppling over. Mine is 36" tall and one of our kitties loves to s-t-r-e-t-c-h up tall and loves the little hanging fluff balls. The sisal on it is strong and glued on pretty well - it may not last for another 6 mos. but this thing is doing a great job for now and I\'d be happy to purchase another one.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHXHER5BSDJ4WJF4S5ZU2KVAEUXQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  It was much bigger than I initially expected but no complaints there. The bottom half of the scratch post material is already coming off though after only have it for a week or so. I can see the wood.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHOOSYS5V46A4LVXMYQ3FAFKH7EA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Very easy to assemble. Works great when I show my cat how to use it. Now, if she will just use it it would be nice. She likes the corner of my bed instead but it looks very nice sitting on the floor.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEIFE5Q2T7FOTUOV6K6P3IPPZHUQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 3 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  The tube is just thick cardboard and the tube separated from the base in only 2 months use. We have 2 Persian cats that are under 8 pounds each so it was not something that received a lot of abuse. Not durable at all.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHZVLY7SHN3WB2MY5VLVKHVPXBDA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Perfect height for my cats to reach, easy assembly- allen wrench provided.
reviews.review: \n  Easy to assemble & comes with an allen wrench so you didn\'t need tools. My cats love it, it\'s the perfect height for them to claw standing up, and not too bulky, fitting in living room fine along with the color scheme.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFCOSPYUVLYCXXFG5QVCRKTNMXZA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Height is adequate but the diameter of the pole is quite narrow and it is very light weight. One of my cats attempted to use it but it moved and he immediately lost interest. I bought this for the cats to use until I can rewrap their other ones.  I will keep it but possibly change the bottom.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHI4VDFD6V3QXMHLVWY3ELN4FYKA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  My cat loves the post and took to it straight away.  Arrived within 24 hours and was setup in 5 minutes.  Very happy.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGQW6FUF25MDLKRN5BDP7WJQUULQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I have 3 of these around my house for my 3 kittens. They love to run up them and balance on the top. Great scratcher with the added benefit of being a toy!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEZCEYI37NZSQWKCW7MVR3RM5TJQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 3 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  They probably could have used more rope, was like this after 2 days.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGHMVEWITJBQJQWU6EC4WJVXLTRQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Looks nice when first together.  Sisal rope starts to work down.  After a month  backing is exposed about 2 inches on top of both sections.  Other ones we\'ve had didn\'t do this.  There should have been more rope rope for this not to happen.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHCZ2HNXI4PYD3Z2RQQI7UHHFBDA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Bought a different post first, green one that looks like cactus, cats wouldn’t even go near it. 10 seconds after this was assembled one cat was already using it. They don’t seem to care about the balls and it’s sturdy enough where our year and a half can climb it and it supports his full weight no problem. Would buy again.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGZ3J3V5VRKVDA3TO25QWXX24J6A
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  We have had a lot of fun joking about our cat on his stripper pole. He seriously loves this thing and being a bigger boy, it’s sturdy enough for him. I may need to put something on the bottom to keep it from slipping when it’s not on the carpet.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGDNP5JXKLFZU4OUGULUY2RBSZPQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 3 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  The office kitten likes it very much.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHZUZS7QGBTCGML4MWR7SCQ3PAAA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 3 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Easy to put together and the height is great!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AE6EQSY73UB4W53BSOIFYCYX57OA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I only bought about a month ago and my two cats have already almost scratched the rope on the bottom off.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFENMTCOKDCXPWEBM4ASNB67MPLQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n I bought this item because it\'s 34" tall which allows my adult cat to fully stretch while scratching, It easily assembles in about 5 minutes with the supplied allen head. It has two attached balls which my cat plays with and another attached separately to the large base (16"X16"} so no tipping hear. Compared with similar items it\'s also a bargain at about half their price.

I highly recommend!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEF2Q2NHXG5DYTDJK2LIXCAECVXQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  The two adult cats looked at it but didn’t touch it. It’s been up for over a week and no scratching has occurred. They prefer the old wider posts in the house. I didn’t realize the post was smaller in diameter than the other posts we have. This would be better for kittens in my opinion.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGWHC4666IMBKS4NQE63YOQVR27Q
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  It does exactly what I needed, which is to protect the corner of the couch. They have pulled it over once or twice but I usually just keep the corner of it wedged under the couch and it holds. It\'s nice and tall, providing my boys with a nice stretch. They don\'t care much about the little attached toys but they love to scratch it.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AEIQCP5JLJTSPJYX5QQOFNQC3VSA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Easy to assemble and both of our kittens use it often.
reviews.review:
\n We only have this one post for out two kittens. They use it quite often. If they start scratching on furniture we simply gently carry them to the post and they continue on the post. They seem to gravitate toward this more and more as they grow. They also often play on or around it.
While it\'s a skinny pole, they both enjoy climbing and standing on the very top.
It was completely simple to assemble. It comes in compact packaging. The construction seems plenty sturdy for our needs.
I cannot think of any negatives.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFRSUDQWTXHJ5KPX5VUOVXU6IB5A
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  So, I received this item and immediately after looking at the directions realized that there is a whole entire piece missing. The whole spring part, which is supposed to screw into the base, isn’t even in my package. I don’t really have the time to send it back because I’m trying to train my cat, but in essence, I paid to only receive a part of my order. There was also cardboard already exposed on the actual post upon opening the package. Next time, I’ll probably just splurge a little more to buy my sweet baby a quality toy that he really deserves.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AH56JKWVTKIL7QWBJRZUUEEIIXIA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  My cat loves the scratching post it’s a decent size and every morning after her stretch she goes up to it and scratches on it instead of my couches so I am loving this scratch post!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AGRGHFJUI5IJKXC53Z4FX3PE4OTQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Nice height for kitty stretching.  Base it too small so it wobbles.  Biggest complaint is the pole itself it connected to the plastic connectors with little staples that are easily pulled out of the plastic ring holding the pole onto the base. There are also staples at the top which were concerning as kitty could get his claw caught in them when stretching to scratch.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHQQPDRJDU7TRG47MUINBNMUVM5A

reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n I had rescued a trash kitten and he was a big climber. Needed something verticle.
He cannot get enough of climbing it and perching on top. My older cat loves to scratch upon it as well.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AE76B3BTWEOLC65H6JUN2V3HOJOQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: Perfect cat post for the price.
reviews.review: \n  Highly recommend! All my cats love this and they haven\'t scratched walls or furniture since 🤣 so far it has held up well would definitely buy again\n

reviews.review: \n  This cat scratching post was assembled in less than 10 minutes.  Seems very sturdy.  Cat is loving the extra play toys that are a part of the post and base.\n

reviews.review: \n  Scratch pole is just the right size for small kittens.  They play a little with the puff on the rope.  It\'s entertaining and good exercise for the kitties.\n

reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful

reviews.review: \n  My cat loves to scratching post. Very durable and the color actually maxes are accent wall, hence the reason why I purchased it. That\'s a solid product.\n

reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  It has a small footprint so it doesn\'t take up a whole lot of space. The balls and doodads keep the cat occupied. Over all it was a great purchase.\n

reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Easily assembled and my 9 month old took right to it. This scratching post is the perfect height with little distraction from anything other than that.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHXU2XFWY3OBSBG373RITUTWRIXA

reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  Nothing to dislike.  I set it near the side of my couch to save it from claws - it worked. She uses the post now not my couch\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHRMPZ5V7KG43QYAX4J42UR6XMGQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I ordered this a few weeks ago for my cat. She really liked it and at first was able to use it multiple times a day. I noticed it seemed to be leaning one day and when I went to adjust it the whole thing just collapsed. As you can see in the picture, the scratching post is still intact, but the connection where it screws in was too weak. Very disappointed.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AH2GXJZSSQOLAQNI7ZJAN6KC33OA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  My 2 pound kitten tore this to shreds almost immediately which also made a mess everywhere. This is the only scratching post I’ve had this issue with and he’s not particularly rough on toys. It’s not durable. I’d recommend purchasing something else.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHCBMZZQQUU2VL4F6JYRTYPBN5NQ

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AF4ELKLIZG4DDD7JHYUQSDOSXQ5Q
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review_title: A Scratching Post Built To Last
reviews.review: \n  I bought one of these over a year ago when I adopted my cat Maxwell.  In that time he has gave that post a beating every single day and although a lot of the cord wrapping is pulled off- it has stood up to the his daily abuse in fine style. Max is a Norwegian Forest Cat. "Wegies" are climbers and they have extra strong claws that grow back extremely fast after a good trim. Max also has a six foot high cat tree as and he can use his front claws to pull himself up to the top, so I needed a good strong, ultra durable cat scratcher for him when we brought hi home.  There are several features that I love about this post.  First the base is wide and attached to the post very securely. As strong as Max is- and he is tall enough to reach about twenty inches up the post- I have never had this tip over. Heck, it has never even moved during the most furious scratching session.  Second, I like how it comes in two heights for extra large cats and average size ones. Also, it is built of really durable material that can take a beating and last for a very long time.  I HIGHLY recommend this post if you got a cat that loves to scratch. In the time I have had this post Max has never touched a piece of furniture with his nails. He  loves this thing as  much as I do!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFNACT4MLU243POBVE666TFVUPGQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
reviews.is_verified_purchase: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 2 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n One of our cats old scratching post started rocking back and forth every time a cat tried to use it so I chose this one as a replacement. From a human viewpoint, assembly is a no brainier using the included tool. Its the small additions that I appreciate, such as the large washer on the bottom that should stop any more rocking, plus the small rubber feet in each corner to keep it from sliding around. Its also not overly large or tall and fits perfectly in a corner.

The feline viewpoint is shown in the posted images. Its received the full nose check from our 6 cats and they seem to really enjoy the spring loaded puff ball, puff balls being a favorite in our house.

Final verdict:
Human: 5 stars
Cats: 5 stars

Thanks for reading this review and I hope its helpful\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AHJQU5RGIC3NAW3FJXGMX57DZIWQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
reviews.is_verified_purchase: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n Besides this 22” post and the 34” post on this page, there is also a 29” post on a separate page, which I also have. They are identical except for height. The taller one can tip over (due to the somewhat small base), which hasn’t happened with this shorter one. (Of course, the best would be a tall one with a larger, heavier base, since my cats love to stretch up when they scratch, but they have a cat tree for that.) Decent but far from fancy.

But that’s JustMe. (I received this product in exchange for an honest review, and that is what I have offered here.)\n

im sure any cat will love it

reviews.review: \n  As you can see from the picture, this is not a huge scratching post, but it\'s a good size for kittens.  It does stay put and doesn\'t fall over, and the kittens love the dangling ball to bat around.  They compete to climb to the top, then bat each other to keep the others off the top.  Good quality, nice looking.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFIKEYI2AHF2PDOPGZT4DWQ672DA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 4 people found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n Owner reviews, price + product dimensions helped me choose this on Amazon. I was hoping to find one suitable for both growing kittens and adult cats (over 30" height - most listed on Amazon were under 2feet).

I decided to adopt my last 2 kittens due to my age. After this batch, I\'ll likely be adopting senior cats in need.

My cats are outdoors/indoors, so I needed an indoor scratch post to keep them away from drapes and furniture. My adoptees took to this post right away, how grateful and blessed am I!

It was very easy to assemble, and what I especially liked is that I CAN ASSEMBLE IT WITH ONE POST (LOWER HEIGHT) for the kittens; THEN, AS THEY GROW, HEIGHTEN IT BY ATTACHING THE 2ND POST. The 2 dangles and whack-a-puffball have been an absolute draw + deeelight to watch!

I cannot review its durability, but can edit my evaluations later if necessary.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFMEQCVAA32YJQCQURJI5PFGF4BQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: One person found this helpful people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  I wanted a smaller scratch post so I could move it to different areas where behavior was happening. This fit the bill perfectly. My kitten\'s love to scratch the wrapped sisal as well as play with the attached balls. Sturdy with no tip-overs yet. Written directions for assembly were a joke but pretty easy to put together after I ignored them. Can\'t speak to durability yet but it looks as well constructed as any others I\'ve seen.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFLUPMR2S7QTBHUCRZYZTERNNXXQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review:
\n It was fairly easy to put together - I took the advice of another reviewer and built it upside down & top to bottom. A second pair of hands would have been useful for the screwing everything to the bottom but I managed alright. The construction seems really solid and durable and my *large* cat has thrown his weight at it top & bottom and it didn\'t tip over, which is always a concern with cats.

The blue accents are gorgeous - I love that color. The rope is very prickly - the cats don\'t seem to mind it, but it was unpleasant for me to hold and felt like it kept giving me splinters as I assembled it... but I\'m fine - no actual splinters.

The balls got my cats\' attention right away; but they seem so interested in playing with them that they aren\'t using the pole to scratch! My cats are finicky though - they won\'t use cardboard scratchers either.

So it\'s well made & pretty & interesting to cats... but you never know how a cat is going to use a thing so your miles may vary.\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AFOLJB4UM5P4X4EYOCUSZDROFSQQ
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  We had a small scratching post but needed a larger one as the kittens started growing.  This scratching post has been perfect! Each of them like to climb it and play at the top and it has never toppled over.  I am very happy with my purchase!\n

reviews.author: amzn1.account.AF7FVBATJTP637TFAOUVLAMNN4PA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviews.people_found_useful_num: 0 people found this helpful
reviews.review: \n  This was a very good size for the price. I have a smaller one and my big kitties keep knocking it down. I need to distract them from the sofa so i got this. Other scratchers at the same price are shorter so this is a steal. It’s tall and stable, comes with the dangling ball thing that will entertain them more. I spray some catnip and they immediately get to work lol they scratch it every day. It’s tall enough for them to stretch too. Im glad i found this after looking around. My sofa can live in peace now lol\n
